swamp verb
(COVER)
[ T ] to cover a place or thing with a large amount of water: High tides have swamped the coast. The boat was swamped by an enormous wave.

swamp verb
(TOO MUCH/BIG)
[ T often passive ] If something swamps a person, system, or place, more of it arrives than can be easily dealt with: Foreign cars have swamped the UK market. I'm swamped with work at the moment. Don't let feelings of depression swamp you.
[ T ] informal If clothes swamp you, they are much too big for you.
